content: black widow spiders are arachnids that are known for their peculiar red hourglass-shaped marking on females abdomen they are considered the most venomus spiders in north america even though their bite is rarely fatal to humans if you are an arachind fan you can use this pattern to make your own black widow spider this pattern requires intermediate crochet skill level as it combines crocheting and wire working instructions are divided into three sections so that each body part pattern is described separately 1 abdomen 2 head and thorax 3 legs finished product should be 17 cm 6 69 in long and 13 cm 5 12 in wide with legs while the body alone is 6 cm 2 36 in long and 3 5 cm 1 38 in wide the size may vary depending on your yarn and hook size the hourglass-shaped marking is embroided on the abdomen since i did not know how to crochet it to look good material - black yarn 55 % acrylic 45 % fleece wool 3 5 mm - 50 g = 115 m steinbach wolle - red yarn 100 % acrylic 3-4 mm 50 g = 133 m bravo originals - hook size 2 mm us b/1 uk 14 - yarn needle and scissors - fiberfill for stuffing - marker - measuring tape - 1 cm copper wire for handcraft - pliers and wire cutting pliers - super glue strong fast-acting adhesives abbreviations r = row magic_ring = magic_ring chain n = chain the number of times stated single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch increase = 2 single_crochet in the next stitch decrease = single_crochet two together hidden decrease half_double_crochet decrease = half_double_crochet two together hidden decrease … * n = repeat whatever is between the brackets the number of times stated fo = finish off 1 abdomen r 1 3 single_crochet in magic_ring 3 r 2 3 increase 6 r 3 1 single_crochet 2 increase *2 10 r 4 2 single_crochet single_crochet increase *4 14 r 5 4 single_crochet single_crochet increase *4 2sc 18 r 6 6 slip_stitch * 2 single_crochet increase *4 22 r 7 10 single_crochet 3 single_crochet increase *3 25 r 8 8 slip_stitch 17 single_crochet 25 r 9 25 single_crochet 25 r 10 1 single_crochet 8 slip_stitch 16 single_crochet 25 r 11 12sc 13 half_double_crochet 25 r 12 2 single_crochet 8 slip_stitch 15 single_crochet 25 r 13 2sc 8 slip_stitch 3 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet decrease *3 22 r 14 2 half_double_crochet decrease 6 single_crochet 2 single_crochet decrease * 3 18 stuff with fiberfill r 15 1 single_crochet decrease 5 slip_stitch single_crochet decrease *3 single_crochet 14 r 16 1 single_crochet decrease *4 decrease 9 r 17 fo leaving a small tail weave in the yarn tail in front loops of the rest 9 stitches then pull to close the hole hide the end 2 cephalothorax head and thorax r 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 6 r 2 6 increase 12 r 3-r5 12 single_crochet 12 r 6
